intro: Nemocharis radicans, commonly known as the creeping nemocharis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its spatulate leaves and unique inflorescence structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as marshes and wetlands. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread easily along the ground. The flowers, which are usually green or white, are accompanied by a conspicuous spadix and are often pollinated by insects.
